snp2.14:376: “I ask you, Gotama, one of broad wisdom:How does a good disciple act,whether one who has gone from home to homelessnessor those lay followers who live at home? (1)
snp2.14:377: “For you know the course and destinationof the world together with its devas.There is none equal to you, one who shows the subtle meaning,for they say you are the excellent Buddha. (2)
snp2.14:378: “Having directly experienced all knowledge,you reveal the Dhamma, taking compassion on beings.Your coverings are removed, you are the universal eye;stainless, you shine radiantly in all the world. (3) [67]
snp2.14:379: “Erāvaṇa, the nāga king, came into your presencewhen he heard you are ‘the Conqueror.’Having consulted with you, he departedNorman readsmantayitvājagāma.Jagāmais a perfect form ofgacchati.Pj II369,16accepts the received reading of the verbajjhagamāand comments:ajjhagamā ti adhiagamā, gato ti vuttaṃ hoti. Norman (GD230) adopts von Hinüber’s suggestion that we read here “an historically correct perfect formjagāma,” which “not only corrects the metre, but also gives a better sense, since we need a translation ‘went away,’ which a form fromadhigam– would not give.”[saying] “Excellent,” delighted to have heard [your words]. (4)
snp2.14:380: “King Vessavaṇa Kuvera also approached you,inquiring about the Dhamma.When questioned, you answered him, O wise one,and he too, having listened, was delighted. (5)
snp2.14:381: “Adherents of other sects given to debate,whether Ājīvikas or Nigaṇṭhas,all fail to overtake you in wisdom,as one standing cannot overtake one walking swiftly. (6)
snp2.14:382: “These brahmins given to debate,and also some who are elder brahmins,are all dependent on you for the meaning,as are others who think themselves debaters. (7)
snp2.14:383: “For this Dhamma, subtle and blissful,has been well proclaimed by you, O Blessed One.All wish to hear that alone: when asked,declare it to us, supreme Buddha.I read here withBeandCetaṃ no vadaas againstEetvaṃ no vada.Pj IIrecognizes the latter as a variant but gives primacy to the former.(8)
snp2.14:384: “All these bhikkhus sitting togetherand the lay followers as well [wish] to hear it.Let them hear the Dhamma realized by the stainless oneas the devas listen to Vāsava’s well-spoken words.”Vāsava is another name for Sakka, ruler of the devas.(9)
snp2.14:385: “Listen to me, bhikkhus, I will proclaim to youthe cleansing Dhamma; all retain it in mind.I read here withCeandEedharātha, as againstBecarātha.[68]A thoughtful person, seeing the good,should adopt that deportment proper for a monk. (10)
snp2.14:386: “A bhikkhu should not wander at the wrong time;but at the proper time he should walk to the village for alms.CeandEehavegāmaṃas againstBegāme.For ties stick to one given to untimely wandering;hence the buddhas do not wander at the wrong time. (11)
snp2.14:387: “Forms and sounds, tastes and odors,and tactile objects drive beings mad.Having removed desire for these things,at the proper time one should enter for the morning meal. (12)
snp2.14:388: “Then, having obtained alms on the occasion,having returned alone, one should sit down in seclusion.Reflecting inwardly, one should not let one’s mindwander outside but should keep oneself collected. (13)
snp2.14:389: “If he should converse with a disciple,or with anyone else, or with a bhikkhu,he should speak about the sublime Dhamma;he should not slander or criticize others. (14)
snp2.14:390: “For some contend in debate,but we do not praise those of slight wisdom.Ties from here and there stick to them,for they send their minds far away. (15)
snp2.14:391: “Alms, a dwelling with bed and seat,and water to wash the dirt from his cloak:having heard the Dhamma taught by the Fortunate One,a disciple of the one of excellent wisdomshould use these reflectively. (16)
snp2.14:392: “For in regard to almsfood, a lodging,and water to wash the dirt from his cloak, [69]a bhikkhu will not cling to these things,as a water drop does not cling to a lotus leaf. (17)
snp2.14:393: “Now let me tell you the householder’s duty,how one should act to become a good disciple.For this entire duty of a bhikkhucannot be carried out by one with possessions. (18)
snp2.14:394: “Having put down the rod toward all beings,toward those in the world both firm and frail,one should not kill living beings or cause to kill,nor should one approve of others who kill. (19)
snp2.14:395: “Next, a disciple should not knowinglytake anything not given anywhere.One should not cause stealing or approve of theft;one should entirely avoid taking anything not given. (20)
snp2.14:396: “A wise person should avoid impure conductas one would avoid a blazing pit of coals.But if one is incapable of the celibate life,one should not transgress with another’s spouse. (21)
snp2.14:397: “One who has entered a council or an assemblyshould not speak falsely to anyone.One should not make others lie or approve of false speech.One should entirely avoid speaking untruth. (22)
snp2.14:398: “A householder who espouses this Dhammashould not indulge in intoxicating drink.He should not make others drink or approve of drinking,having understood that this ends in madness. (23)
snp2.14:399: “Because of intoxication, foolish people do evil deeds,and they make other heedless folk do such deeds. [70]One should avoid this basis of demerit,delightful to fools, causing madness and delusion. (24)
snp2.14:400: “One should not kill living beings or take what is not given;one should not speak falsely or drink intoxicants.One should abstain from sex, from impure conduct;one should not eat at night [and] outside the prescribed time. (25)
snp2.14:401: “One should not wear garlands or apply perfumes;one should sleep on a bed or a mat on the ground.For this, they say, is the eightfold uposatha observancetaught by the Buddha, who has reached the end of suffering. (26)
snp2.14:402: “Hence confident in mind, having observedthe uposatha complete with its eight factorson the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth of the fortnightand during special periods, (27)
snp2.14:403: “in the morning the wise personwho has observed the uposatha,rejoicing with a confident mind,should distribute food and drinkto the Bhikkhu Sangha in a fitting way. (28)
snp2.14:404: “One should righteously support mother and father;one should engage in a righteous business.A heedful layperson, observing this practice,reaches the devas called self-luminous.” (29) [71]
